title: Josue Baeza
text:
About me
I’m an analytical biochemist working in biopharm drug development. This means that I use mass spectrometry-based techniques to understand the chemical structure of proteins in the pharmaceutical industry.
My PhD and Postdoctoral training was focused on using high-resolution mass spectrometry to address structural, biochemical, and biological questions.
I’m also a self-taught data scientist. This came out of a necessity to understand and interpret the large data generated by mass spectrometry-based proteomics.
Outside the lab, I love to spend time with my family and enjoy a backyard barbeque.



Interests

Mass Spectrometry
Proteomics
Data Analysis in R
Reproducible Research
BBQ




Education

PhD in Biomolecular Chemistry - University of Wisconsin-Madison
BS in Biology - University of Texas Permian Basin

title: My First Blog Post
text:
For the past two years, I’ve been talking about starting a personal wesbite. This past week, I finally did by following this tutorial
To add a blog to the new website, I followed much of the information found in this post
Voila, a new website.
Now to include some executable code…


Code
iris %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_classic(base_size = 18) +
  coord_fixed()
